alert.note: Alert for Central Coast Range of Western Oregon; South Willamette Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 10:50PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Benton and northwestern Lane Counties through 1115 PM PDT... At 1049 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Triangle Lake, or 21 miles west of Eugene, moving northwest at 40 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Triangle Lake, Greenleaf, Deadwood, Blachly and Horton. In Oregon this includes State Highway 126 west of Eugene between mile markers 34 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized ponding of water. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Coast Range of Western Oregon; South Willamette Valley
